Reviews.Author: Yu-jin Chia "Yu-Jin Chia"
Reviews.Content: I got one of these for a friend, someone who I know isn't going to be picky about hardware specs and speed. There are a lot of entry-level Android tablets out there now, some of which are sub-$100 models. You can actually get this one in that price range if you find it on sale, but what sets it apart from a lot of others is it's actually not half bad.On that note, a word of warning- most if not all other tablets in this price range are little more than child's toys. They tend to have very weak hardware that can barely handle Angry Birds and will lag seriously if you try to stream video. Furthermore the build quality is shoddy- they use cheap plastic and glass that affords poor viewing angle, has bad glare in bright light, and is very easy to scratch or break.The main reason I even gave this consideration is it's made by Asus. I've used Asus hardware for a very long time- everything ranging from motherboards to graphics cards, monitors, laptops, routers, and most recently the Nexus 7. Generally speaking, their hardware is very solid in terms of performance and reliability. In fact I can't think of a single time I've been disappointed by one of their products. I figured even if this tablet was suspiciously cheap, it was probably at least decent. And it is.First, expectations. This is not an iPad and you aren't paying $500+ for it. If you expect it to perform like an iPad, you WILL be disappointed. It's also half the price of the similar-sized Nexus 7 and of course not as nice. But for what you pay for, it's surprisingly good. Particularly, it has these pro points:-- A lot of internal storage (16 GB), twice the Nexus 7 base model and as much as the Kindle Fire HD base model.-- It is an Android 4.1 Jellybean tablet. Most tablets in this price range are 2.3 or 4.0-- It has a micro-SD slot, which is very noteworthy. Many significantly more expensive tablets, including the Nexus 7, do not have one (the cheapest decent one I know of is the Galaxy Tab 2 7, which is about $70 more).-- Pretty decent hardware and chipset- it's comparable to the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7. I at first thought the VIA chipset would be considerably slower, but it's actually so similar as makes no difference. It's robust enough to run some pretty heavyweight apps, and can stream HD flawlessly.-- Light weight, solid build. The tablet has a rubberized back that feels rugged and affords good grip. It is about the same size and weight as the Nexus 7.-- Good battery life. It lasts about as long as its more expensive cousins, especially if you don't use 'performance mode.'-- Comes with an AC adapter. Might not seem a plus, but these days a lot of electronics don't include one, which can be a pain.I suspect a lot of the complaints I've seen about apps and performance have to do with teething bugs. When a new device is released, this is pretty normal- a few updates usually fixes it. I've seen little in the way of these problems so far. That said, there are of course some downsides to this tablet:-- The display is average at best. Touch controls work fine, resolution is not bad, but the viewing angle is very noticeably more narrow than a lot of higher priced tablets (not terribad though, like the Dell Streak 7). It also seems to suffer more from glare, possibly because the backlight doesn't seem to be that powerful even on full brightness. It's by no means unworkable but if you're not looking straight at the screen or if you're viewing it in bright light, it's harder to make out detail.-- As with the Nexus 7, the speaker (note singular) on this tablet is pretty mediocre. You'll want headphones if you listen to music or stream videos. It works fine for things like Skype though.-- Ditto with the camera, which is essentially just a webcam. Unlike the pretty decent cameras on the Galaxy Tab 2, you're definitely not going to be using this to take pictures.-- No bluetooth. This is probably the biggest minus as far as feature set goes, and though the virtual keyboard is well done, it's still not great for things like email. This also means there's no wireless file transfer, though the SD slot and cloud storage mitigates that.-- Some apps are apparently still incompatible at this writing, notably Instagram 4.0 (however, I was able to sideload 3.5). I don't expect this to remain an issue for long.Overall, I would say this is a solid tablet considering what you're paying for it. I will also note though that you can 'fix' pretty much all of those cons by paying $60-70 more for a Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 Still, for a device that you can get for as low as $80 on sale, this is a surprisingly good performer. It's practical, inexpensive enough to gift, and doesn't cost so much that you'll be scared to use it.Edit: 8/9/2013- just to add a few extra points in the MeMO Pad's favor:-- This thing actually supports USB on the go. I was frankly amazed by this since a lot of much more expensive tablets and phones do not (including the KFHD). I've tried flash drives and a voice recorder; both work perfectly (you'll probably need a 3rd party cable for this).-- The battery life on standby is pretty good. I've let it sit for 2 weeks with minimal use (wifi and sync on) and it still has about 1/4 charge. Not bad.I've noticed that the 1st gen Nexus 7 has received a massive price drop (probably due to the release of the 2nd gen) that makes it much more competitive. The MeMO pad is definitely still the choice if you're on a budget though.
Reviews.Title: Surprisingly decent budget tablet

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace an older outdated tablet that i planned on giving to my 6 yr old. At first glance this tablet seemed amazing for the price, then i used it on a regular basis. I will start out with the good. The screen is responsive and works well, the battery life is ok if you set the WiFi as off when standby, and the apps that are downloadable work well. The internet and chrome seem to also work well for a tablet of this price. Now for the bad. I found that alot of the apps i like are not compatible with this model/tablet for some reason? There is no bluetooth, and the front only facing camera is horrible. Netflix does not work unless you ok with the audio and video being off by .25-.50 second. VuDu, Wikipedia, Netflix, Gamefly, and a few other apps are not even available from the play store due to "not compatible". I have had this for 1 week and decided to return it and spend the extra $50 for a Nexus 7 or a Samsung tablet.Pros-good screen and touch response, works well for some apps/games and for minor internet use. I did not test this tablet with skype!Cons-alot of apps are not compatible, streaming videos is not an option, camera sucks, no bluetooth.
Reviews.Title: Very entry level.

Reviews.Author: Takayuki Ono
Reviews.Content: I've been using Kindle Fire 1st generation as my comic reader. I loved it very much except one which is that there is no external memory slot. It was a little inconvenient to copy files into Kindle fire because of the slow speed and limited size. Now, with this one, I can add 32GB micro SD card to the internal 16GB space. If you pick class 10 micro SD with good card reader, the file copy is much faster.Adding to it, I can have a video chat via skype and camera, I can still read kindle magazines via Kindle app, and it's cheaper.My only concern is that the battery lasts 7hours compare to 8hours for Kindle fire as a spec. I'll see how different in the actual usage...So far, I'm very happy with the tablet.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price

Reviews.Author: Jake Hart
Reviews.Content: I bought these for my two daughters to replace their Nintendo DSi XLs. They sold their DS and games for $300 so we were on the hunt for 2 tablets we could buy with that money. We were looking for a 7" Android tablet made by a reputable manufacturer, that came with a current version of Android installed and had expandable storage via a micro SD card slot.This tablet had all of those things. I read several reviews that complained about the graphics and processor speeds. I bought these tablets despite the negative reviews and I'm glad I did because honestly I personally haven't experienced anything they were talking about. I'm not having any of those issues. My kids get partially paid for chores in Google Play gift cards and download TV shows, books, music, games and apps from the Google Play/Android store. They use the tablets to watch Netflix, Hulu and Amazon Prime on their tablets and the media looks great. It's not grainy or choppy and these little things have some killer speakers on them. Also if this tablet is for your kids, the parental controls are easy to set up.I looked at a lot of other tablets like the Google Nexus (made by Asus) but it was twice the price and didn't have a micro SD slot. Then I considered the Samsung Galaxy Tab which DID have a micro SD slot but was twice the price, had an older OS and had been on the market for 2 years.Bottom line... for $89 these were a super buy! We have not had any issues with them whatsoever. If you are a college student or an adult I could understand how you would want/need a bigger, better, faster tablet. However if you're looking for something to give to your 10 to 17 year old, it's perfect! The biggest selling point for me was...  at $89 my kids were able to buy them with their own money. That has made them feel a lot more responsible for the devices. Worst case scenario, if they lose it or destroy it, they won't lose any data because everything syncs to their Google account and they can afford to replace it themselves.
Reviews.Title: What's not to like? Great value for the money! I would definitely buy again!

Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: I used this tablet for few hours last week and for the price of $150 it is absolutely unbeatable. Obviously if you are into role playing games/fast car racing games, this will not cut.If you are into most apps like I use, it works remarkably well. I loaded up my google account and synced some of my appsSome of the apps I have tried on this tablet and which worked well are -- Amazon Kindle, Battery Monitor Widget Pro (shows accurate measurements), Car Reminder Maintenance Pro, Chrome, Draw Something, Google Drive, eBay, facebook, Flashlight (very handy), Flipboard, Keep (though Samsung note app is great), LastPass, Merriam Webster dictionary,  PAC-MAN, Pogoplug (gives me Terabytes on the go on wifi from my home private cloud), RealCalc (great calculator program), Nike Running+ (great visualization), Subsonic, Skype, Tweetcaster pro, Withings (weight watcher app), Youtube, Terminal Emulator. The video based apps are a bit choppy. When I used TWIT.tv, it was grainy at first, and I suspected wifi. But wifi was good based on other tablet experiences. For this price, you cannot go wrong!
Reviews.Title: For the price, unbeatable

Reviews.Author: Jus10
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet because I wanted something smaller compared to my larger tablet.  I didn't want a iPad because I have a iPhone and I didn't want to pay more than 150ish for the tablet.  I considered getting the Nexus 7 but I couldn't justify spending 200 on something I will only probably use for a few months and then put away somewhere.  After reading some of the reviews I decided to go with this tablet because A. Asus makes the Nexus 7 and B. It looked basic enough for me to get what I want out of it.  I basically wanted a watered down Nexus 7.When I first received it, I set it up right out of the box and noticed it was running really choppy and slow.  I figured it was because it needed to be charged fully and restarted.  After doing that a few times the performance did not improve.  I was THIS close to just sending it back and getting the Nexus but I decided to reset it and try again; I'm glad I did.  It works MUCH better! Most of the apps I use on my iPhone and other tablet I was able to get on it.  It's fast and pretty responsive.I do have a few complaints:*Not all apps are compatibly with it (I downloaded the apps that weren't off the internet and they work just fine now)**Camera is "meh" (I'm not one of those that takes pictures with their tablets but the iPhone front camera is still the best by far!)*No bluetooth (I did the research so I already knew before I bought it. Still lame though)*Screen quality is a 6.8 out of 10.  (I was expecting better quality but I'm not all that much of a graphics queen)
Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for

Reviews.Author: crazybrit "lifeisajoy"
Reviews.Content: I got this because I wanted a small, no-fancy-bells computer that can connect to the Internet in public spaces (no Wi-Fi at home) when I'm not home. I usually connect to the 'Net once or twice a day from home, and I feel that I miss a lot that way.As for the tablet itself, the startup time is a little slow (at least ten seconds). And as someone else said, there's no knowing when it's fully charged, you have to turn it on to see that. But that's a minor issue. I've also tested the camera and I agree that a rear one would be better, but I'm okay with it. Unfortunately though, I've owned it for two days and it's already crashed once, but I expected that. (saw that in other reviews) And file backup is recommended just as with any other computer, so I'm not going to store important files on it because you may lose them, and any apps that you've installed may go back to their original settings, when the tablet is rebooted/restarted. Also, check the tablet's startup/standby settings because it may autolock when you turn it off then turn it back on again. That's all I can remember right now.But so far the issues are minor because I'm going to use this tablet mainly to go on the 'Net and check emails. I don't foresee installing any apps or games, but I might add an SDHC card because I will download and then transfer files between this tablet and my old desktop computer (trying to get an Android simulator to do that).Overall, this is good for what it can do, and for what I need.Update 6/29: Took it to a public Wi-Fi spot. Worked great, ran smooth, no problems. Another reason to keep it.Update 7/19: I shouldn't make predictions! Of COURSE I've added a few apps and games, and a few "live" wallpapers too. All with no problems. And the tablet has automatically downloaded some upgrades (oops, don't want them to be automatic), I don't know if that's why it hasn't crashed for a good long while now. I also got a USB 2.0 A to Micro B Female / Male Adaptor, so I can use USB "sticks" with it. And oh yeah, the battery's good for at least three hours while I'm, uh, WiFi-ing. Still going to keep it.Update 7/23: PHEW...My bagstrap suddenly broke last night, the bag fell a few feet to tile floor...fortunately the bag was full of stuff so the tablet was ''padded''. And I'm using it now, so give it a point for toughness.Update 8/16: I got a mini-memory card stuck in the slot. Yikes. Couldn't get it out. Didn't call customer service because that's not covered in the warranty and I wanted same-day service, I didn't want to mail it or take the long trip to the closest authorized repair place. Found a closer place that charged a reasonable price. And since I can use regular USB drives with the Memopad (via the adapter) I'm not sure if I want to get another mini-sdhc card.Update Nov. 15: One of my worst fears: The screen got stratched. But not too badly. Very likely would have to pay for replacement so not going to bother right now.Update Jan 22 2014: It rebooted instead of unmounting an external usb drive. Not good. Will use the new charging/data transfer cable I bought to get files to and from this and other computers. May have to reset it again, this would be the third time. Gah.Update April 2014: It froze while transferring to a USB drive via the adapter. Maybe it doesn't like the drive or adapter, or maybe it was cranky, or...whatever. It's ok now. But looking into buying another tablet.
Reviews.Title: It's good for what I need.

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: I got this on sale at Office Depot after Mother's day. I was looking for a tablet that I could use for my basic needs that don't really require my ASUS EeePC heating up my lap. I preferred to stick with the brand and not get an off brand at Big Lots. I like it so far. This is my first tablet. It seems perfect for a student that doesn't demand serious gaming, or a super crisp text. I read books just fine with it and prefer it. It doesn't have bluetooth, GPS, or a camera on the back, but I don't have that on my netbook either and I don't feel like I'm missing out on anything. The response is good. The ASUS pre-installed apps are nice, I wish I could get rid of some of the Google Apps that are pre-installed. Rooting instructions are not available on the internet yet, so I will have to wait for that. Anyhow, I would recommend this to anyone that likes to read, surf, play games that aren't resource hogs, and just wants to organize their electronic life on a handheld. I read a lot of reviews before getting this on different websites, and I think the people reviewing this was a bit bias. There is definitely a niche for this product. It is a quality product. If you don't need all the extras, but want a brand that will stand behind it's products, consider the ASUS MeMo Pad. If you want something high-falutin' look elsewhere. That's pretty much the bottom line.
Reviews.Title: Better than expected

Reviews.Author: Baal K'reeah "Baal K'reeah"
Reviews.Content: This was a very economical price for a great performing Android tablet.  We have had it running for several weeks and it has performed as we expected.  It connects via wi-fi with no issues.  The battery was running down very fast at one point but we contacted customer support and they had us run the tablet down to 0% then hold the power key down.  Battery now gives us about 3-4 hours of run time.  It will be fine when leaving on all night to use as an alarm clock..The screen is very good for a 7" tablet, clear and easy to read.  The Android system has worked as expected.I am very happy with what I got for the price.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price

Reviews.Author: Nathaniel Clay "NatT96"
Reviews.Content: Reading and even watching many reviews online, many reviewers say how poor performing he tablet is, when honestly I have noticed it is not the tablet its jus the applications that running it and yes, by simply updating them, lots of performance issues were fixed. Netflix works flawless after updating it on he play store. the sound quality of the device is surprisingly loud and the ASUS Audio Wizard is very useful and allows sou d adjustments to your preferred media. Now the screen quality is not horrible, the only issue is the viewing angles (which have not bothered me because I have plenty of other devices). The device has no Bluetooth for keyboard use,I would care less because  have my MacBook. Gaming on the other hand can slow down at times (but not major lagginess) and depending on the game' I simply swipe the status bar down and choose "Performance" and sometimes "Balanced". The device plays media well, multitasking is surprisingly very good and many of the negative reviews all have there little fixes.PS:Guess what I typed this review on.UPDATE: ASUS ISSUED AN UPDATE FOR THIS TABLET IN APRIL (2013) TO 4.2 UPDATE, BUT IT NEVER HAPPENED. SO I AM CURRENTLY CONTACTING ASUS FOR EXPLINATION.
Reviews.Title: Ok, Now This Tablet Is Not As Bad As it Seems....Nice 7 Hour Battery Charged Budget Tablet

Reviews.Author: MICHAEL ROBERTS
Reviews.Content: i recieved this 2 days ago and right out of the box i was very excited and nervous because some of the other reviews on here but i charged it up with no problems and i started importing all my purchased apps and other things to it and had no problem whatsoever i saw in other reviews ppl where having problems. I could not download the crackle app though and it does not have flash capability which suks but i can deal with it. also you cannot leave it plugged in because it does not have a smart charge capability and you can damage it that way by overcharging it. But overall performance is good 32gb sd card feature is awesome and the camera is good for skyping with the kids, very happy with the screen resolution and the speed no lagging or crashing and the movies look good. the brightness of the screen is good for me too. overall this is a good tablet i would recommend it and i will.
Reviews.Title: very solid

Reviews.Author: Asa Chapman
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for the price and specs. It was a gift for my almost 2 year old daughter, it has already withstood a month of total abuse. Plays videos very well and has a very responsive screen.
Reviews.Title: Works Nicely

Reviews.Author: Town Without  Pity
Reviews.Content: First off, I am totally new at using a tablet!  My go-to device is a Toshiba Netbook, which I hope will last forever and a day.  That being said, I am still learning how to work on a tablet, but for what I wanted it for, it's perfect. I've downloaded an app and an ebook from the Chicago Public Library site, my son downloaded my favorite VLC video program to watch movies, I can check my email, see facebook and twitter, and all is good.I've seen complaints from others about only a front side camera and no bluetooth, but, honestly, the specs on this tablet are distinctly and openly listed on this very site, and there's no reason to complain about something that wasn't offered prior to purchase!  Read the spec description on any device first before ordering so you know what you're getting.I can't say what the tablet is capable of doing as far as game playing, but I've downloaded a Scrabble-type word game onto my tablet, and it's great.  My netbook has only 1GB of RAM, just like this tablet, and it's just not going to keep up with memory hog games, simple as that.Hope this helps anyone on the fence.  I think it's a very nice device for the price.  It's a perfect on-the-go device, IMO, when sitting in a waiting room and wanting to have something to read or do in the meantime.
Reviews.Title: Good Product for Price

Reviews.Author: Niraj
Reviews.Content: It's a cool product ,worth the price odd 130$. Don't expect to be same in the ranks of iPads or Nexus, but yeah , it is a nice tab to hang around with.. Touch is good,though not impressed much with the camera.
Reviews.Title: Cool Tab

Reviews.Author: beatrice s
Reviews.Content: Easy set up, light weight, great to travel overseas to check email facebook google wifi available in most hotel or airport and you cannot complain about the cost...Bravo ASUS Great Product.
Reviews.Title: Cheap and great Memo Pad tablet

Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: This is the third tablet I have had, and the first one I have been satisfied with. It fits what I was looking for in every way. Very happy with it. Great memory, wonderful screen resolution, just an all around solid tablet.
Reviews.Title: Absolutely fantatstic!

Reviews.Author: Reginald Anderson
Reviews.Content: I bought the ASUS MeMo Pad 7 a couple of weeks before the new 2nd gen Nexus 7 was released. For the $100 price it is a decent tablet with Jelly Bean 4.2. My main problem with this tablet is that some of the apps from the Play Store are not compatible with the device. What upset me was the fact that the incompatible apps work with my old Samsung cellphone with Android 2.3 Gingerbread. The Play Store just tells you that the app in incompatible. No reason given. When the 2nd Gen Nexus 7 was released I immediately ordered it and was overwhelmed! But guess what? Those old apps that do not work with the MeMo Pad 7 work with the Nexus 7 and my old Android 2.3 cellphone. I ended up giving the MeMo pad 7 to a relative...
Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMO Pad ME172V-A1-GR 7.0-Inch 16 GB Tablet ( Grey )

Reviews.Author: jim boyle
Reviews.Content: Has very poor battery life (couple of hours). did not have Bluetooth. hard to find on/off switch. very nice screen,
Reviews.Title: ok but

Reviews.Author: A. M. Ahmed "Amaiko"
Reviews.Content: this tablet is only for checking emails or surfing internet and maybe maybe some lite games.I thought I would be better than this but it's my fault because I did not listen to advices in some reviews.I used the tablet for 2 days and get bored of it ... the charger also verrry slowww even I use my camera charger for it because it charges the tablet faster.Anyways, Don't do make my mistake and pay extra $50 to get nexus even you need it for only emails because checking your email or surfing internet with slow tablet is going to be annoying task.but if you only looking for the cheapest tablet with good features get it but don't expect too much it's like these Chinese cheap tablets.
Reviews.Title: Pay extra 50 usd and get Nexus

Reviews.Author: qinhbu
Reviews.Content: we have a 10 inch tab, this is a valuable tab. the price is good for this product and meet our expectation
Reviews.Title: good tablet

Reviews.Author: Nancy L. Gossen
Reviews.Content: It is just the right size for me to play my games on.  I am addicted to Candy Crush and it is wonderful for that.  Good for all ages, my 8 yr old grandson likes it too
Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Author: isableandaking
Reviews.Content: So I got this tablet, because of it's low price and attractive features - very similar to the twice as expensive Nexus 7 that is also made by ASUS, but a lot less powerful. It was primarily to be used for skype and some light news reading maybe some video watching. The 1MP camera that could do 720p for video calls seemed perfect and the single core processor should have been enough to handle video. Well that wasn't the case, the video was terrible - the resolution never went up from 320x240 - this is 2013 and I kind of expect more. I easily get 720p through my desktop computer, so it's not the network connection or anything like that. Then there was the microphone - the people on the other end said they could barely hear me, so I figured OK, it just needs an external microphone, no big deal - pluggied in my iPhone headphones and voila, they could hear me perfectly again. This wasn't the dealbreaker here, as it would have still provided basic functionality, but then I tried Netflix...It stuttered and spewed at NON-HD videos, I don't think it even gave me the option of using HD, afterwards I read that other people had been having the same problems. Oh and to add to the mix was that the videos were extremely silent on MAX volume settings, also the speaker is located on the back of the tablet, my little iPhone blows this thing out of the water with it's stereo speakers that are on the bottom. I left it to charge since it was charging very slowly, the next day I started using it again and it seemed like the battery went down really really fast, so I put it to charge again. After a couple of hours I checked on it and it said it was charged completely. Then I started using it again playing around with features and it was maybe drained to 62%, so I just left it in standby mode. After a couple of hours I tried using it again, but this time the tablet didn't react, it was like it's off. So I tried holding the button for a long time, but to no avail. Then I tried plugging it in and after maybe 5 minutes I tried pushing the button again, this time it worked, but it's like the tablet was off - the battery showed something like 50% and it was charging again. When it reached 70+%  I tried unplugging it and using it - all was well. But then again, it seemed like the battery didn't charge or didn't realize that it had a charge - so it went in OFF mode again and again. So yeah this is the dealbreaker, returned. Will probably have to get the nexus7 which costs around twice as much, but it will at least give me basic functionality.
Reviews.Title: a really bad first android experience

Reviews.Author: momsquad3
Reviews.Content: We really like this easy to use tablet.  We bought it for our 8 year old granddaughter.We were going for a kindle but this offered so much more. Very easy to navigate. The shippingWas fast.
Reviews.Title: 7in. asus tablet

Reviews.Author: RUSKIN PIEDRA
Reviews.Content: Fast, clear pictures and sounds, quick downloads until connection is lost, which happens frequently but just as quickly reconnects and all is well.
Reviews.Title: Excellent for videos

Reviews.Author: Alex Boafo "Atoapem"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet just to store and play music. Its performed fantastic. I was attracted to it cause of its 16 gb internal storage and its ability to read a 64 gb external mini SD card. Similar ones I bought could only read up to 32 gb. With a total of 78 Gb I am wll set for my music lifetime  It has perormed both extremely well Downloads are easy and fast Will recommend it highly for the reasons I bought it
Reviews.Title: Fantastic

Reviews.Author: 8500ins
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect tablet for anything. It works great for games, browsing, apps, books...It's a great size, lightweight, it's small enough so you can take it almost anywhere, but not too small. I haven't found any problems with it so far. I also have a kindle fire- the touch screen is more responsive on it, but other than that I prefer my memo pad.
Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Author: Maria Lugo
Reviews.Content: I got one for my little girl, and ended up getting my whole family one; its a good product at a good price.The only thing is that its not compatible with Bank of America, Wells Fargo, and Pay Pal.
Reviews.Title: Affordable Price

Reviews.Author: wearemr
Reviews.Content: Bought for 10 year old daughter. I was a little concerned about the apparent lack of memory, but after a few months of her using it constantly, I see that it has plenty to run the apps she wants to run. The display is top notch for watching movies. The battery life seems average. I would highly recommend buying the service plan along with this.
Reviews.Title: She wont put it down

Reviews.Author: lori moreno
Reviews.Content: i am a mother of 6 kids.. well we all know how kids love to share so we were looking in to tablets for christmas this past year. after about 3 months these tablets are still just as great as when they got them. i even bought for my lil sister, if you are looking for a great deal on tablets all memo tablets seem to be great :)
Reviews.Title: great product for price

Reviews.Author: Veronica Chatman
Reviews.Content: I brought for my daughter as a birthday gift and she loves it no problems so far she uses it to surf the web, play games,  oovoo, etc...
Reviews.Title: PERFECT FOR AN 11 YR OLD

Reviews.Author: G. Setaro "GSV"
Reviews.Content: The tablet do the essential thing its responsive, fast, small, and you can take and go everywhere with it, for the price its a good and smart option.
Reviews.Title: The tablet essential thing

Reviews.Author: marbear
Reviews.Content: Thinking I was purchasing Asus quality  NO NOT THE CASE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Terrible picture I have the Asus tf700, which is winderful  this isnot. I downloaded an app  by disney I played the game for about an hour and then received a notice that this device does not support this app .  What does thsat mean??????????????????????  Also, I could not get apps for Bank of America, Amazon and many more commom ones.  I have ordered a kindle refurbished 32 gm with all the bells and whistles for 159.00  And, I know this will work..... and if I have any problems Amazon will stand behind their product and not insult my intelligence.  All I wanted was atablet I could carry in my purse.  I think I have solved that problem
Reviews.Title: very disappointed

Reviews.Author: Brian Rogers
Reviews.Content: Good product for the price..No it's not an Apple or a Samsung, but functions just as well for the average tablet user for a fraction of the cost.  It's fast, has good quality video, etc....
Reviews.Title: Great Value

Reviews.Author: Casey Sullivan
Reviews.Content: It does most things i could want.  Games being the only area lacking in power.  Worth the $87 i spent on it.
Reviews.Title: Good afordable tablet

Reviews.Author: Rachael Woolard
Reviews.Content: Widgets are handy and good apps for everything you need, but internet is somewhat slow, if you're used to an ipad.
Reviews.Title: Worth about $100

Reviews.Author: Erin Reed
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7 yr old son for Christmas and he loved it! It's a little on the slow side, but it's perfect for a young user. It arrived exactly when expected and was packaged very well. The one I purchased was refurbished and described as being in good condition with a few marks and scratches around the outside. To be honest, I really had to look to find any mark at all. I am very happy with my purchase.As a side note, when it arrived, my husband and I opened it to check it out and pre-load some apps on it. When it turned on, it said that an update was available. My husband has a Nexus 7 and had installed this update on his, when prompted, a week or so earlier and it bricked his tablet. He did some research and that was a known issue with that particular update. He was able to fix his after some frustration. Thinking ahead, we made a backup of the ASUS before we installed the update, and just as we expected, it bricked it. Since he had already dealt with this and we had made a backup, it was no problem to get it working again. So be aware that there's a risk with installing the update it will probably prompt you to install. Make a backup and do some reading online first though, and it shouldn't be too big of a problem. However, that was no fault of the seller, so I didn't want to dock stars for it.
Reviews.Title: Great Christmas present

Reviews.Author: Scott Vallejo
Reviews.Content: Cant pry this out of my mother hand ever since I gave it to her a year ago! She is absolutely in love with her tablet!
Reviews.Title: Mom Hasn't Put It Down

Reviews.Author: Alan Cameron
Reviews.Content: I bought this device for one of my children this Christmas, and she loves it. Granted, she's only 10 years old, and doesn't have any serious technical needs beyond You Tube, Netflix, and simple games, but this tablet is able to handle those needs well. I haven't experienced any of the delays or other glitches some reviewers experienced with Netflix or other video products. This tablet is well worth the money I paid for it.
Reviews.Title: Good entry-level tablet

Reviews.Author: Tammi
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for my Grandkids.  They love them.  It is great for book reading and streaming videos.  I have to limit their time on them.
Reviews.Title: As a Gift

Reviews.Author: Stanley
Reviews.Content: The device is good for the needs, I have and apps are very good,the screen is bright and clear and the sound is good too. Please be advise that youwill want to purchase, a screen protector, the finger prints linger on the table, so please have a good screen cloth to use.
Reviews.Title: Great small tablet for Memos and E-reader and mp3s

Reviews.Author: Pat O'Brien
Reviews.Content: Well, here is the deal.  I simply wanted a tablet that would suffice to pick up email and do some surfing without having a lot of complicated stuff.  So far, it is doing okay.  It's a little slow in unblurring the text when it appears and, it is a little sensitive....jumps off site with slightest touch.  But for the price, it works for me.
Reviews.Title: Okay for this user.

Reviews.Author: Bryan Foster
Reviews.Content: So I want to preface this review by saying that I have not owned a tablet before this, just smartphones and PCs. This tablet is not particularly powerful, so I found myself having to restrict what I wanted to do with it. This is not a gaming tablet, and cannot handle most gaming applications. It is in the most essential of ways, a general use tablet.Pros: - This tablet has the phone shaped design for a 7" screen, making it somewhat easier to hold than an 8.9" or 10" tablet. - It comes with the Play store unlike most tablets in this price range. - For the price range, this tablet performs well enough to be a solid pick amongst the other entry level tablets.Cons: - It is an entry level tablet. Long boot times and general lag in the performance - The tablet will freeze from time to time in loading applications and waking up from sleep. - Tablet shuts off at random times for no reason. - There are no drivers to connect the tablet to the PCOverall:  This is a very good entry level tablet, but if you are a power user or are looking to play games with a tablet, you may need to look elsewhere as this tablet will not deliver a good gaming experience. I would suggest that this would be an excellent tablet for reading books or magazines, but not much else.
Reviews.Title: Good entry-level tablet, not good for much else

Reviews.Author: __eMpTy__
Reviews.Content: The tablel is only and single core, but it has 768mb of RAM and the processor is clocked at 1.7ghz. It works perfectly as a Chromecast remote (and bed-side web browser) for my parents.
Reviews.Title: Minimal, but functional

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Okay yes, it's an entry level tablet, it's not going to do what the $250-$500 tablets do. If you're buying a $100 tablet, you should know that anyway. However, this one does allow me to do anything I want to do on it, I watch Netflix & YouTube on it, play games like Candy Crush, Angry Birds, & Fruit Ninja, I use the Kindle & Sony apps to read on it. My son has some interactive books on it too. It does all of these things. Which is what I wanted it to do. I use my phone for social media so I didn't need a tablet for that, but I know it can't have instagram, not a big deal. I do shop on it with the Amazon, ebay, Walmart, & Target apps. It's a good tablet for someone who doesn't want to spend a ton of money and just wants it for casual use. I do use head phones when watching movies, but I'd do that with my computer or a more expensive tablet anyways so that doesn't bug me.
Reviews.Title: Good basic, entry level tablet.

Reviews.Author: Delano
Reviews.Content: Very good tablet, fast and easy to use. have not had any problems. has 3 modes (Balanced, Power Save & Peerformance)Everything works great on Balanced mode. its best to lay some games in Performance mode to prevent minor stutter.I gave it 4 stars because certain applications are not compatible with this tablet. (eg. Instagram,  BBM etc.)
Reviews.Title: Great!

Reviews.Author: Gerald D. HARDIG
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wife as a birthday present and she loves it. Hasn't put it down since. Will order more atems in the future.
Reviews.Title: Everything is as advertised.

Reviews.Author: ...theBuanna "...DamnHonky"
Reviews.Content: Where do I start...bought VisualLand 7" & was happy but no G play or front cam, and charger issues (like a crow bar, the plug wreaked havoc in the port and eventually only able to charge (slowly) from USB). Gave that one to my daughter and bought a "DragonTouch" (good reviews) but malware !  Dλππ& 4.2...returned & bought NextBook  w 4.1 and would've loved it - but it struggled to do simplest tasks plus temperature issues due to over taxing an  inadequate os...then got a "hisense"? (spelling) again ...underpowered & malware. When would it end ?AT LAST..."ASUS"memo pad" (because it was under $100.00 and in stock) @ WalMart and with little else to choose from...I took it out of the box...KNOWING I would soon take it back ...dreading initializing process yet again.But almost as a godsend...the little tablet that could ...(Netflix...Skype...EweTube...ect.) no problems ! It is set on a 4.1 platform & 1.6 G  ram Speed -YES... only one speaker...only one cam... NO bluetooth...but I promise THE perfect under $100.oo tab for most everyone...EVERYONE ! ...except your "gifted 7yr. old" I was so happy (and still am) I wrote this review...on my new Asus. (Oh yeah , 24hr support)  ...theBuanna@hotmail-comments welcome.
Reviews.Title: Finally...I found it ! $85.oo ...perfect tab (but no dual cam)

Reviews.Author: Callison
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my Granddaughters birthday; she's had no problems with it and uses it all the time, (since August 2013)for her homeschooling and internet browsing. Hasn't experienced the unexplainable crashes that I did with the 10" ASUS MeMo Pad. Very happy with it.
Reviews.Title: 7" ASUS MeMo Pad

Reviews.Author: Ricky Devon Hicks
Reviews.Content: My niece was blow away with the tablet for her sweet sixteen party. A big hit!I would recommend this low cost product for anyone in the market and on a budget.
Reviews.Title: Ricky H- review ASUS MeMo Pad ME172v-A1-PK 7-inch 16 GB Tablet

Reviews.Author: Yuriy
Reviews.Content: I really like this tablet. Easy to use and great quality!!! If you are looking for great 7 inch tablet this is the best choice!
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet ever!!

Reviews.Author: D. Cash
Reviews.Content: This thing has been perfect, battery last well over 8 hrs of use, a little less watching movies or streaming video from places like Max Go and Netflix. I would do it again, actually already have for the daughter, but in pink.
Reviews.Title: Best $120 I ever spent

Reviews.Author: Jerry Basinger
Reviews.Content: this item does everything my apple I pad does except  it has no rear camera.  I love and use it all the time
Reviews.Title: Love the size

Reviews.Author: richotep
Reviews.Content: Good deal, arrived on time, product as described, this is one of the best under one hundred tablet on the market.
Reviews.Title: Good Deal

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pros: Screen, "feel", speed, simplicityCons: Volume, app availability, slippery uncasedI bought each of my 6-year old twins one of these tablets.  I spent some time making it kid friendly with apps they can use, and locked the rest using the included app-lock app.  The tablets have a quality feel to them, but they were slippery in the hand.  I quickly bought cases for them, as I was nervous whenever I saw my kids walking around with them. We used them for a long trip in the car, and I loaded movies as well as games.  It was a success!  The kids were able to play games or watch movies that entertained them for the long trip.  They were even stimulated by the educational titles. We do not use netflix, so I cannot comment on that, but HBO GO works well.I would recommend this tablet for someone who has very simple needs from a tablet.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price!

Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Overall a good deal.  Use it mainly for reading books and it works great.  Battery life is about 8-10 hours.  I did end up disabling some of the apps that came with it.
Reviews.Title: Asus Memo Pad

Reviews.Author: M. Gubala "Matt G"
Reviews.Content: at its market  price approx $155 @ staples in 2013  probably was a decent deal, ever since the HD  version came out and the price dropped $50, I cannot believe the value.  16gb  is not usual in many entry level price tablets in 2013  that alone is a big + Acer support is very good in 2 separate trials  I was comparing with an 8 gb tablet  Samsung 7 Inch  But this one was the right choice. A 16 GB jelly bean tablet @  approx. $99 bucks cannot be beat. The ability to install apps to the internal storage  helps with those apps that don't work with  Micro SDHC cards  Some super users might complain, however I am only coordinated enough to use 1 or 2 apps at one time, built in Asus' front end and task manager, bundled apps are a built in +++
Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE  for a good tablet

Reviews.Author: Naresh
Reviews.Content: Very cute, small , handy tablet. Google options are awesome.sound is not great.good for money spend.not a great tablet. but kind of ok tablet.
Reviews.Title: Nice tablet

Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: I rated it three stars because it's useful and what I needed, but not what I was expecting. There were minor bugs I had to work out, like it randomly shutting off or closing out my work when the battery bar said it was full, or refreshing my pages on google chrome. Overall, without those faults, this was a good product and I would have a fifty percent chance of recommending it.
Reviews.Title: Review

Reviews.Author: Ramon Tavarez PS-2800
Reviews.Content: This tablet doesn't wait to execute applications, widgets or settings.its 16 GB memory provides enough storage space.Lightweight design, but strong.
Reviews.Title: A very fast device!

Reviews.Author: Leonard E. Sica
Reviews.Content: She loves it ,, works great for her playing APP's ,, cannot seem to load Flash Player though . Overall pretty cool
Reviews.Title: For 6 year Old Girl

Reviews.Author: Pedro F Cairo P
Reviews.Content: Very good team, very fast, excellent connection, only negative has a camera in front of the screen, excellent for skype
Reviews.Title: Excelent

Reviews.Author: oepixels
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a good deal for the price, initially was looking for one under $100 but wasn't excited about anything i found in terms of specs and the reviews were no help either. so I came across this one; although never bought anything ASUS but i know their laptops are good, so i went for it, not expecting much! to my surprise it was worth every penny at the end, still don't think it will work as well as the high end ones maybe half way but for basic stuff this one is the one.
Reviews.Title: Good tablet for the price, would nuy it again

Reviews.Author: Randall Arrington
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a couple months ago as a gift for my wife on her birthday.  She absolutely loves it.  I may have lost her to it.
Reviews.Title: My wife loves it

Reviews.Author: Amable
Reviews.Content: Although it is not comparable to Nexus 7 the price make it a good deal. It runs all the apps from play store and if you are going to use it for reading mails, surfing the Internet and running average applications, this is just what you need.
Reviews.Title: A very good item for the price!

Reviews.Author: Debra Skurski
Reviews.Content: This pad performs quite well and is very economical.  It is limited with respect to the camera since it is front facing only and 1 MP.  However, it is excellent for social networking, playing games and checking email and news.  Works well for what I need.
Reviews.Title: Good Pad for the Money

Reviews.Author: Deana
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7-year-old grandson so that he would leave my iPad alone. What a good purchase. He has his games on the pad but I hid any icons that I did not want him to access such as stores or internet. It is a good size for him and he is really enjoying it.
Reviews.Title: New toy

Reviews.Author: Bella
Reviews.Content: I liked this tablet. It was a little heavy though and some of the apps crashed. I ended up returning it and getting a refund because I want the newer version and this version just wasnt doing it for me, its very simple and its not the updated version of android so some of the apps didnt work. Its the perfect size i just wish it wasn't so slow sometimes. Great company though.
Reviews.Title: Okay

Reviews.Author: Mary Walters
Reviews.Content: Have thoroughly enjoyed it! Everyone in the house is always using it to check emails, or watch you tube.  It's great because it's portable, lightweight, and does as much as our computer, just faster
Reviews.Title: ASUS  Memo pad

Reviews.Author: amazainiak "amazainiak"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet to replace the galaxy tab 1, 7 inch.  No comparison to the Galaxy tablet, the screen has a funny glare on it that makes watching movies almost unbearable.  It seems pretty fast but as stated in other reviews Netflix  and other streaming services have an audio delay that I was unable to fix.  Games such as temple run 2 will play but about 15 seconds in to a run you get lag and then die.  I purchased this to do two things, play simple games on and stream Netflix and other services.  It was unable to do either efficiently.  Purchased the galaxy tab 2 7 inch to replace this.  I would not recommend this table, very poor display angles, week processor, and no Blue-tooth.  Spend a little more and get something that will work.  I used this tablet for 4 days and reset it twice to make sure it wasn't something I did that was making Netflix lag.
Reviews.Title: ok tablet for 99 bucks, but NOT good for streaming services

Reviews.Author: STEVE S. "Steve S"
Reviews.Content: I bought it because of the good reviews, and the decriptions seemed to fit my purposes well. I need it for browsing the internet around the house as well as on the road; and backing up pictures when I travel. It proves to be good value because, for $110, it works like it is supposed to - connects to the available wi-fi network well, battery lasts 5 days for my daily usage of about 20 minutes a day so I can probably stream a 2-hour movie, memory storage expandable by an extra 32 GB with a micro SD card.I later bought a memory card reader from Plugable Technologies from Amazon which can plug into the talbet's micro USB port (same port to charge it with). Then I tested putting the memory card from my camera in the card reader; and I could copy pictures from it to the micro SD card in the tablet. So mission number 2 accomplished.The text on the screen is not as sharp as I would like it to be sometimes, and it has glare under the light. But I already expected these slight imperfections so it is not a problem.I would recommend it.
Reviews.Title: ASUS ME172V 7-inch tablet

Reviews.Author: rws
Reviews.Content: It is a basic tablet. For the price, it is a good deal. I've had mine for about a week and am very satisfied. It does what I need. I just check email, surf the net and play some games. I found it very responsive and have had no trouble with downloading apps. I love the size. Again, it is a good basic tablet and it should not be compared to a more expensive tablet.
Reviews.Title: good deal for the price.

Reviews.Author: Madelein Fernández
Reviews.Content: The tablet is beautiful and works properly, I have not had propblemas with it, I recommend it, it is a good option at a good price
Reviews.Title: Good product

Reviews.Author: dedapr
Reviews.Content: It works better than most Chinese tablets in this price range. At least it latches on to WiFi quickly each and every time you turn it on, which is something most Chinese tablets don't do w/ out switching on/off the WiFi a few times!Pros: SD card is nice, micro USB data/charger port is convenient, pebbled finish on back is easy to hold on to & you can use it w/ the Google Play store as well as the Amazon App store.Cons: Is not compatible w/ many popular apps. Even simple weather and card game apps. The on/off switch is recessed and very hard to operate even if you have long nails, same w/ the rocker volume control. The screen is barely bright enough at full brightness, it's OK but you need to keep it on max, resolution is OK but could be better. No Bluetooth or HDMI out.Is it worth slightly over $100? Probably if you only really need a tablet for audio/video podcasts to use in any room around the house like I purchased it for, still I'll try and get used to it for another week and then decide if I should return it or not.** After spending more time w/ this tablet I have decided to return it for 2 important reasons. 1- The recessed on/off and volume buttons take way to much effort to get pushed in. Obviously they are used many times a day and are defective by design. 2- As I mentioned I bought this mainly to be able to listen and view podcasts around my house. There is a definite lag between the audio and video! It's always out of sync. I compared it side by side to an Asus TF-300, a Galaxy Tab 2 and a Lenovo A7, and the others worked fine while the Asus Memo was out of sync. Terrible experiance trying to watch anything!
Reviews.Title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought the Asus for my nine year old.  She plays games, and watches movies on the go.  I would have went with a Nexus 7, but I want to be able to add a microsd card.Pros: MicroSD CardCons: Battery last about 4.5 Hours.
Reviews.Title: ASUS

Reviews.Author: El Panameno
Reviews.Content: If you are not sure if you need a tablet or not for the price of this one you could safetly learn the ropes about using a tablet. This unit has a very fast respose, works very well. It takes a little bit of playing around with it to know some of its functions. It syncs music and pictures but does not copy videos unles they are in MP4 format. The camera does not take great pictures but hopefully you own a digital camera that does and you can trasfer your pictues, this device will display them well. the speakers have low volume but it plays great with the ear bugs. works very well with the most popular apps such as Netflix, facebook , pandoras to mention a few. Do not accept all kind of app. some banks do not have apps for this operating system. IT is good entry level tablet for a very reasonable price
Reviews.Title: nice entry level tablet

Reviews.Author: Vladimir Theodore "Apollo Lir"
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet for my 4 yr old son for his b-day. There was was no way I was gonna spend more than double for an iPad. So far, so good. I pre-loaded kid apps and Netflix before I gave it to him and he's the happiest kid ever right now. For the most basic functions, it works great. Only thing is, it only has 1 front facing camera which is pretty weak so if you want 2 cameras, spend the extra few bucks for the Galaxy Tab
Reviews.Title: Perfect price for what it is

Reviews.Author: KNB "KNB"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Price! (at under one hundred and forty dollars in 2Q 2013, this is a decent value)Yes it has a microSD slot (and it read my 64gb card w/o a problem)It has Android JellybeanFeels well built IMO with a housing that is not a fingerprint magnetFlat/thin enough (it's no iPad mini but it's also less than a third of the price)Cons:NO bluetooth!! (dealbreaker for me)Screen has a horrible viewing angle (SVGA) (dealbreaker for me)Battery life so soLow quality front-facing cameraNo rear-facing cameraOS lags at times (especially with mp4 videos and perhaps others)I'm taking mine back (purchased at a competitor for more than Amazon sells it for) after only a few days due to the cons. If the above cons are not important to you, this is a very good buy.
Reviews.Title: Narrow viewing angle! NO bluetooth! Low price! Entry Level!

Reviews.Author: Mason Karle
Reviews.Content: Pros:- cheap- solid build- microSDHC slot- 7"- ASUS brand (not random Chinese factory named)- Running Jelly bean (4.1)Cons:- Horrible screen (actually blurry at random times when watching videos...most likely a defect)- Horrific and quite simply unacceptable viewing angle. The other reviewers warned...I thought it would be different. It wasn't. When watching sign-language videos you have to be directly infront of the screen to watch clearly. The slightest movement causes the signer to dissappear.- Suprisingly heavy- Sluggish- Doesn't work with JWLSL! Got JWLSL working but had to sideload it. Then when working switching between videos it would freeze. Simple task not handled by this little guy!Bottom line:Save your money. Spend an extra $40 and try the ASUS MeMO Pad HD 7 (on it's way).
Reviews.Title: Not good for using JWLSL!!!

Reviews.Author: suzatm
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small tablet where I could load all of my books on from the various ebook sources and have a to do list and calendar  all in one device that i could put in my handbag and have with me at all times.  The ipad mini is something that for the money spent is not something i want to take with me and pull out.  The Kindle Fire does not allow the other book sources to be on it.  I had the Samsung Galaxy Tab 7 for one day and hated it.  The touchscreen was not very responsive, browsing was difficult because of the reaction problem in addition to the constant dropping of the wifi connection, I could not get my Verizon email account to be recognized and there were too many pages of apps.  The Asus MeMo is exactly what I was looking for.  Everything downloaded quickly, the wifi connection has been strong, easy set-up, all of my books are there, my Verizon and my Gmail accounts installed right away and browsing with zoom was great.  The screen is very responsive and the resolution is very good.  The only complaint that I have so far is that the light at the lowest setting is still too bright for me.  All in all no regrets in the purchase.  When/if Apple  kills my mini ipad 1st gen I will definitely be looking at the Asus MeMo 10 inch hd tablet.
Reviews.Title: I really like this

Reviews.Author: Minnesota Debs
Reviews.Content: I hated this thing. I found out I am definitely an Apple person, not an android person.  Why 4 stars then?  I gave it to my daughter who never had a tablet.  She has just launched a career in sales that is quickly rising and she needed something exactly like this.  It tells her how to get to her sales calls, keeps track of her leads, entertains my grandson, etc.  And you Android people know exactly how it does all these things.  It is not an issue for her that it's an entry level tablet because she's an entry level user; she doesn't even have a smart phone.  Go ahead and buy it for the tablet neophyte in your life.
Reviews.Title: Great buy, just not for me

Reviews.Author: Ari Schwartz
Reviews.Content: she loves it! Bought a refurbished name brand for just $20 more than a generic china 7 inch tablet with 3 x the warranty period and local authorized repair stores if necessary. Working fine so far.
Reviews.Title: bought it for my daughter

Reviews.Author: Elias
Reviews.Content: Was a good deal for the price and for my younger kids to play games on it.. playing Netflix on it is real choppy and out of sync. There is a camera on the back side with no light ... but you can add a mico sd card , mine has a 32gb installed
Reviews.Title: good for the price

Reviews.Author: marekhi
Reviews.Content: great tablet. i buy as gift white asus memo and it works great. looks beautiful. it have a nice screen
Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Author: momof7
Reviews.Content: I own three of these tablets now, so obviously, I like them.  My son has broken his screen in three places and still the thing works fine.  You don't even realize you're working with a cracked screen.  I had gotten the cheaper android tablets before this and the Asus is SOOOOO much better for hardly any more money.  Get it.
Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Author: Dovahkiin
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for a coworker. They say it's exactly what they wanted. Who am I to argue?
Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Author: ZODA
Reviews.Content: I bought it in October and remove the packaging for the month of December as Christmas gift was my girl 2 months after using it without problems, one day while trying to turn on the screen started flashing and there was no way start secion. When viewing the page I found out that Asus, is a failure that occurs when the load is damaged pink. I live in Venezuela and now for me it is very cumbersome to use the warranty. As would do to recover the gift of my child?
Reviews.Title: Inconforme

Reviews.Author: Henry Lemasters
Reviews.Content: I'm an asus fanboy so its hard for asus to disappoint me. I only gave it 4 stars because there are some apps that wont run on it yet, but thats not really their fault.
Reviews.Title: Great economic tablet.

Reviews.Author: David Loomis
Reviews.Content: We have learned that by turning the brightness lower, the battery lasts longer and it is still bright.  Very satisfied.
Reviews.Title: Works well, good deal at a good price.

Reviews.Author: Paul Bennett
Reviews.Content: This tablet was a 1st for our 7-year old.  It keeps her happy, but for a power user, it falls short.Pros:  Asus quality, inexpensive, color choices, decent battery.Cons:  Slow to restart or start from the off status, Slower CPU means certain apps hang easily.Overall, this is a good starter tablet or as a power E-Reader.  Good for watching movies too.
Reviews.Title: Nice starter tablet

Reviews.Author: Smithd20
Reviews.Content: stores all my movies, music, games, apps, and more!i use it to place library books on it for trips, and music for work, and it's amazazing!
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Ginny Stack
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tablet. I bring it everywhere. The only thing I wish it had was a flash. The camera takes good pictures outside but inside you need decent lighting. Anyway overall it is great and the price is good. I've checked out others and thus by far beats them.
Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kevin Schlirf
Reviews.Content: My child says that the tablet does exactly what it was bought for, allow him access to homework assignment and emails. He has never complained about anything concerning the tablet. I think it's time for me to get one.
Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Author: Lam Shan Kwok
Reviews.Content: Resolution is totally no good at all and device itself runs not smooth...find a better deal on tigerdirect and bestbuy.
Reviews.Title: resolution is not really clear and runs not smooth

Reviews.Author: LI
Reviews.Content: When i watch video, the screen make me faint.The screen is not clear at all. The screen makes the video out of shape.
Reviews.Title: screen is bad

Reviews.Author: Melody
Reviews.Content: I am a college student and needed a cheap and light tablet so I could follow along with the professors powerpoints. It's great for simple stuff like notes. I don't use it for games. It can hold a charge for a few days with occasional use. I like it, small, light, cute, and affordable!
Reviews.Title: It does the job

Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a good product for the price. It has intalled android sos. I think it met the expectations.
Reviews.Title: Very good

Reviews.Author: Juan Zuluaga
Reviews.Content: i bought this tablet but its bricked. cannot update, the battery died. i contact the seller and help me with my issue but it feels upset abpout quality of this tablet
Reviews.Title: didnt work

Reviews.Author: Vicky C. Galloway
Reviews.Content: I had been looking at tablets and e-readers for a long time. Getting ready to go on a trip I saw this on sale and decided to try it. I am new to apps. and widgets, (and lions, and tigers, and bears, oh my!) but have had no problem downloading and using apps on this tablet. Some apps, such as the Kindle app, open a bit slowly but work beautifully. The camera leaves a lot to be desired but that's not what I bought it for. I really like the notes app. I love the size. It just fits in a purse or tote while the larger ones don't. Display is nice also. I am thinking about buying one for my mother to introduce her to electronic toys.
Reviews.Title: Great 1st Tablet

Reviews.Author: John Robson
Reviews.Content: I rated this product five stars because it's everything I hoped it would be and more, I would recommend this product to anyone who wants more than just a reader tablet.
Reviews.Title: I love my ASUS Tablet

Reviews.Author: alivora
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy with this purchase. It had issues from the very start, particularly with the camera. It would just stop working and the screen would turn green, I would have to re-start the tablet to get it working again.The tablet continued to have issues, I was careful with charging due to the warnings the instructions gave, and yet there were days when the screen would refuse to turn on after charging. So as you can guess, the actual box the nexus came in was scratched up an dented in pretty deep. So all that aside, when i opened the nexus box the plastic that comes on the tablet looked like it had been used, it was also scratched an sticky. Smh, and sadly it goes on. When i took off the plastic, i proceeded to turn the tablet on. Turned the tablet on, an in the middle of the screen there was a vertical digital line! nothing was wrong with the background but, anything you do on the tablet had that digital vertical line down the middle. I initially sent an email to the seller an received no response back. So looked up their number an gave them a call. When i finally got someone on the phone, they told me that they do not repair or replace. They told me all they could do was refund my money to amazon an then amazon would refund it back to me, then politely added in that it would take a minimum of two months before i would receive my money.  I would not recommend anyone to buy from them. They dont care about the customers or their product at all.

Reviews.Author: Steven Pawson
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these refurbished off of 1sale.com (sorry Amazon) and it is the first tablet I've ever bought, though I've used others at Best Buy, friends houses, and at college for various projects. I like simple reviews, so I've made this as concise as possible.Pros:- 1024X600 Display. While it isn't as fancy as the iPad or the Nexus, the display is more than enough for daily use. Can I discern the pixels? Yes, but any text bigger than 6pt font is clear and Netflix quality is more than acceptable.- Battery life. The MeMO Pad has 3 settings for battery; saver, balanced, and performance. To test its lifespan I played "The Dark Knight" from beginning to end at 75% brightness on balanced mode with headphones in. The movie is 2.5 hours long, and when it was over the battery was at 56%. This means you can watch about 6 hours of video before needing to recharge.- Processing speed. No problem playing "Plants vs. Zombies 2". 1 GB of RAM seems to do nicely for whatever apps I am using. There is a 1 second lag when rotating the screen, but no major problems.- Micro-SD slot. From my own research, this is noteworthy. While the 16 GB internal storage is great (that's about 7 standard definition movies, a few hundred pictures, plus a whole bunch of apps), if that isn't enough then you can triple your space with a 32 GB micro-SD card.- Full access to Google Play Store. Need I say more?- Runs on Android 4.1 OS. My last phone had the 2.3 version. After only a few minutes I could see the difference in performance. 4.1 is a lot faster, more user-friendly, and makes for a more enjoyable tablet experience.Cons:- No outward-facing camera. I don't expect or even want this to act as a digital camera, but I know this could be a deal-breaker for some people.- Touchscreen keyboard. I have fairly large hands being almost 7' tall, so I can't imagine how regular people feel using the sideways keyboard. Vertically, it isn't too bad, although the weight distribution feels off. Some of the keys are in odd places too, like the period and enter keys. Not the worst thing in the world but not as comfortable as preferred.- Speaker quality. This tablet is designed with headphones in mind. The EQ software does a good job but the single internal speaker isn't meant for anything more than system noises. It isn't terrible though, and given how cheap this tablet is, this is probably to be expected.- No Amazon Instant Video. I get that Adobe Flash player is no longer compatible with newer Android tablets, but come on! Half of the reason I love Amazon Prime is to watch Prime videos. Netflix and Vudu are compatible, but Prime has some titles unavailable on either.Final Verdict:I really like this tablet. High marks for battery life, display, and processing power. While the lack of an outward-facing camera and the quality of the speakers make it fall short of its more expensive competition, I would highly recommend it for anyone who wants a tablet for traveling or to use at work.

Reviews.Author: D. Fox
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tablet! I read many of the reviews before purchasing, and was a little hesitant; I have bought a few off brand tablets on price and been disappointed in their speed, and compatibility with many apps. This unit works great in comparisons to those. I only had one app with compatibility issue, and the speed is good for a budget tablet. I think some people are expecting high end tablet speeds and display quality from this unit. I was able to purchase my tablet for $90, for that cost it has performed better than any other budget tablet I have owned! I would have paid up to $130 for this type/quality of tablet. The Asus performed well with all the apps I testing on it. Only one had compatibility issues (media PlayerPro). The tablet does lag at times when running multiple apps, and requires a reboot every now and then. But I have come to expect this and even worse lags from all budget tablets, I highly recommend this one and it is worth the slight extra cost. Battery life is a little low, with constant use you will probably only get about 3-4 hours out of it, it will easily last a day with standard use.  I let my kids use this one, they are not as concerned with quality and speed, and can stay tethered to a computer or power outlet when playing for extended periods of time..

Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I've owned the 250 dollar asus Nexus 7 with 32 gigs.  But this one is almost as good with 15 gigs and 150 shaved off the price.  I was disappointed that Viber and Tango weren't compatible.  But the rest of my favorite applications are there.  I use Google voice, Skype, and Talkatone instead which work the same.  The only complaint I had was the microphone is very faint.  I looked at the docs and located the pin sized mike at the top and tested the input by speaking directly into it and my wife says that the volume is much better and she can hear me ok now.  It's fast enough, even if my phone appears to be quicker.  Unbeatable deal for a 7 inch tablet.

Reviews.Author: A "Reader"
Reviews.Content: This is slow, drags between activities, and failed with the MAIN reason I bought it.  Basically, I bought it to back up pics on vacation.  I have a camera  card reader that has a micro USB attachment (the only input that this device has).  So, I plugged in my micro USB card reader multiple times at home to test it.  All was well.  Then, I bring it to vacation and suddenly it's telling me my pics are corrupted and totally freaks me out.  None of my pics were corrupted - and the guy at the hotel front desk confirmed that (as did I when I got home).  Also, this is very heavy for the size...I'm used to an iPhone weight / density - and this is much more dense.  Oh - speaking of iPhone - here is a good use for this tablet if you travel:  There is a "workaround" that will let you use the "find my iphone" website which you can read about online. The other thing is that it lets you encrypt the whole device pretty easily, which is good again if you are traveling.

After carefull consideration, it really wasn't necessary to buy a tablet because I can get all my downloaded material on my phone for reading. I've come to appreiate my phone more and buying the tablet and all the problems I've had isn't worth the money I've spent. I'd considered getting a Kindle Fire HD but I've changed my mind.

Overall, it's an excellent investment.The only problem I have had is that I have a slight tremor, which makes it difficult to use the virtual keyboard. That's definitely NOT a problem of the MeMO Pad -- and it's getting easier as I figure out exactly how I need to place my finger. I have been thinking that a stylus might help.

Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive tablet just for the basic needs of organizing my life a little and holding a few apps that I like. I wasn't looking forward to spending a big price tag as I really depend on my laptop for all my college courses and everyday use. I am extremely impressed with this little tablet. For $99 it delivers more than your money's worth. I know what it can and can't do and it has more than I need. If you are looking for dual cameras that is the only thing that this does not have that the more expensive ones do. However, with the access to dual cameras on just about every device out there, I am fully satisfied with this having one camera. If you need two ASUS has a wide range of tablets/laptops and are competitively priced. Quality has been top notch on the ASUS laptop that I have had for over a year now and I believe this device will give the same quality. I am looking forward to purchasing these for some teens in my life for Christmas because at this price you can't go wrong and it is much cheaper than a "smart phone".  The only reason I give this 4/5 is the lack of the second camera.

Reviews.Author: Scott Degraffenreid
Reviews.Content: I mainly use this as an alternate e-reader to my basic Kindle and for checking e-mail, a little web-surfing. I didn't want to spend too much since I was skeptical as to how much I'd use it vs my smart phone and laptop. Overall it has been a pleasant surprise. The tutorial was sub par but Android is pretty intuitive. Quality and features seem comparable to my boss' I-pad for 1/4 the price. I'm satisfied but will probably upgrade in a year or two as new features come online for less $.

Reviews.Content: Bought this recently and its not a bad tablet at all even thou it lack GPS and bluetoothASUS MeMO Pad ME172V-A1-GR 7.0-Inch 16 GB Tablet ( Grey ).And it's a brand name too.Great  price, great product

Reviews.Content: ASUS has pushed the market to lower their prices on good, entry level tablets.Bought for my daughter.  Really suits her needs well.
Reviews.Title: good product for the $$

Reviews.Author: Satish Kumar
Reviews.Content: Ordered the ASUS 7" tablet for its attractive price. Amazon fulfilled it very quickly. When I received the unit, I turned it on. The unit said it had a system update to download. Downloaded the update and the clicked on the button to start the installation. The tablet would not start after this step. I waited for 30 minutes and started charging. The unit got so hot that I couldn't hold it on my hands anymore. I did a hard reset and it still wouldn't start. At this time, I just hope that I received a defective unit. I also own a Google Nexus 7" which is made by ASUS and I thought I could buy something directly from ASUS with confidence. However, this experience has reduced my confidence on buying another ASUS product again. Therefore, I am back to shopping for a new tablet.
Reviews.Title: Don't buy. I hope I am wrong

Reviews.Author: davekalyn
Reviews.Content: My son loves his tablet. It does everything that he needs and more. The negative and its a pretty big negative to me was the seller. We bought this item for our son for Xmas. As you can guess we bought it before Xmas time and had it hidden away from prying eyes. Shortly after Xmas the tablet was acting up. We called the seller to see about swapping it for a working one. We were told a very short, "its over thirty days". Repeatedly got told that and only after Amazon stepped in did they do something. By the time that happened we had had it repaired. Again a great tablet, horrible seller. My apologies but the seller was Electronic Express. Big 0 out of 5 on them.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy "DrBalooba"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this ASUS to replace a BN NOOK 8gb device. Without a doubt, this is a better tablet. Faster, better web connectivity, and more stable. I have used this ASUS extensively while traveling, and it has never let me down. I can easily establish a wifi connection at any location. The touch interface works well enough, and there are at least two different keyboards to choose from. Perhaps best of all, unlike the BN device, it allows full access to the Google play store without requiring a hack. Considering its specs, I doubt this is a good tablet for gaming. However, for basic web use it is an excellent performer.
Reviews.Title: Good tablet for basic web & email

Reviews.Author: Jack W. Ferry "jfkindle"
Reviews.Content: I just got it a day ago. But I already had a Kindle fire but sold it to a friend. Then upgraded to the Asus TF700 Transformer Infinity. The Infinity is my go-to pad. This is a backup. The Memo Pad is easy to hold in one hand. The 10.1 inch Infinity is not. I got it to read books, video, surf the internet and listen to pod casts.It will fit perfect on the perch on the machines at the gym. Then you can watch video or listen to music or anything like that. The external speaker is very loud and sounds great. I recommend it for people who don't want to spend $199 and up on a tablet and don't expect to play intensive video games. The 1064 x 600 screen is great at the close viewing length when you hold in your hand at arms length. You won't have issues with the sharpness and clarity. If you are picky about clarity then you need to spend $299 and get 1900 x 1200 or better.Also think about it. At this price; $149 you have not invested in something that better last 3 or more years like I did with the $500 Transformer Infinity.  In a year or two you can get the next upgrade. Remember this is something at the same price point you pay for a smartphone and you move in and out of those every year or two.Well hope you enjoy my review and the memo pad.

To test Android Apps that I wrote in a form factor smaller than a 10 inch tablet.So if it had any real capability beyond that, then it would just be gravy.I believe this "Memo Pad" was designed to be an E-Reader.  It's best viewing angle is vertical (like in the product photo) and looking at it straight on (actually about 80 degrees from the bottom).  Anything other than that it gets weird.  Go to 110 degrees from the bottom and you can't see the bottom part of the image.Rotate it to horizontal and the image takes on a weird 3 D effect.So if all you want is a Reader, it's fine.

Reviews.Author: MarkC Cocoa Beach
Reviews.Content: Needed a budget tablet from a good brand. Uses will primarily be browsing and email, plus real estate listing demonstrations. On the business function the MeMo 172v is a little slow. I need my website to pop when demo'ing to prospects. But now I'll have to explain that tablet is a little slow. That is disappointing but not a big deal.Typical Asus quality throughout. Very impressed and mostly satisfied. Buy the Asus case with kick stand for best protection. Setup was as easy as it gets. It immediately updated the OS to 4.1.1. Enjoy.Update August 4, 2013:Well, let's just say I was stoked. After using the Asus MeMo 172V 7" tablet in the real world... not so stoked. BEWARE: Amazon lists the specs on this unit as having 2 processors. It does not. It is a single-core Cortex A9. There are dual-core Cortex A9 processors in the retail channel (kind of confusing), but this product does not have that CPU version. It is a single core computer. Might return it just on the basis of misrepresentation.
