Reviews.Author: Stella C Klein
Reviews.Content: I know ASUS makes quality tablets, but this is not one of them. I currently have a 10" Acer that I love, but wanted something smaller.  Expected ASUS to provide an adequate 7" tablet just to do common web based apps like browsing, Facebook, radio and video apps.  It cannot handle any of this.  Browsing is painfully slow (found Opera Mini to be the best option) as Chrome and other full featured browsers hang. Videos start and stop, or just hang completely forcing a restart of app or a complete reboot of the tablet. If performance mode is selected (it does not make much difference) be prepared for laptop type battery life.  Where the Acer will go days without a charge, this goes hours, to maybe a day of on and off use. I guess if I considered the low cost of this tablet, I should have set my expectations a lot lower.  It is a good reader so based on that and low cost, I gave it an OK.I need to update my review of this tablet (3/9/14)to bump it up two stars! My biggest concern after I bought it was the horrible battery life and slow network speed. In January the battery died completely and would not accept a charge at all.  Asus honored their warranty and repaired the device in a timely manner with no hassle.  All I can say is WOW; night and day difference in battery life, wireless power and network speed.  I am very pleased with the device now as it can easily go three days (on and off use) without a charge.  It's fast and no longer has issues with video or browsers hanging up. I think I may even like it better than the Acer :-)

Have you ever tried to reach Amazon and talk to a customer service person??  Ha! Good luck.  Just give it a try sometime.I used to love Amazon and I used them all the time. Reviews.Title: Arrived Broken/ Zero customer service

Reviews.Author: Kokorozashi
Reviews.Content: All in all, the MeMO pad is a fairly good quality tablet considering the price. However, if you drop it, expect to replace it. I had this thing about two weeks and was waiting on a case, which unfortunately was coming from the UK. Before it got here, I managed to drop it a couple feet onto a hard surface when it slipped out of my bag. It looked perfectly fine, but something inside got cracked or disconnected, because now the screen is just colors and lines.ASUS customer service is friendly in that disinterested, unhelpful way of most technical service these days. Apparently that repair is not covered under the warranty, even though while they had me on hold the hold message said that the warranty covered one case of accidental damage per machine. This was never quite explained, but whatever: so I ask for an estimate of how much it will cost to get it repaired. The estimate they gave me was $180 (not including shipping). Note that this is a $100 tablet. I was stunned that anyone could even utter such a thing without feeling stupid.I'm going to see if there's any other way to repair it, but I can say that I will not be buying an ASUS product again. The accident was just bad luck, but the surreal experience with customer service has put me off this company entirely.

Reviews.Content: I advise against purchasing this. I had exams to study for, and purchased it so I could read websites, etc. while travelling. First out of the box, my very first attempt at a connection was slow. Not connection wise, as I was connected to a strong wifi signal. Literally, my Samsung S3 is FAR more powerful than this tablet.
Reviews.Title: Pathetic

Reviews.Author: Adam Gagnon
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because I have a 7'' kindle fire and like the size. This tablet was meant to replace my mothers laptop. I returned the item without opening it to get her the kindle fire 8.9'' when I found out such a thing existed. The return wasn't a negative to this product I just went in a different direction.
Reviews.Title: Don't consider this review

Reviews.Author: Michael M. Stewart
Reviews.Content: At first I thought this device to be a great on the go reader, but I was very wrong when I received the device I turned it on without any problems but after a system update failure the device kept telling me that "No USB cable connected". I don't know what that exactly means but it would not boot up into the Android OS. I returned the device for another one, had the same issue after an update. I do not know what exactly I did wrong in the update part but it failed the second time on the replacement device. I have owned an ASUS Transformer TF101 and never had any issues updating it, but for some reason this device gave me issues. Now it could be just a cheap piece of junk due to it being so low in price, I don't really know. Now the ASUS Transformer TF101 was very expensive and maybe that is the difference. If you want low end junk then this device is for you and if you want a stable and non problematic device then this is not for you. Other people's experiences may vary with this device, but with me it was very distasteful.

Reviews.Title: good tablet

Reviews.Author: Tdc1ben
Reviews.Content: Though this was a well made Tablet at a very reasonable price. After getting it & testing it for a few days I found out it was not.You cant watch Net flick or some You tube videos as it does not support plash player witch most online videos use now days.I cant believe that ASUS would put out such a product. If they are it should be stated that the tablet I not for use with watching videos & some other apps wont run on this tablet. I cant use my Walgreens app witch I use for ordering all my medications each month & I use Pay Pal app for paying for items that I have bought. The apps are much easier than having to login the web site & deal with what I need to take care in my daily life. I got an RMA to return the item & I hope that they don't try to hit me for the 15% restocking fee as not my fault that the item does not do what all other Tablets do & that is play flash videos.
